name: St. Addai

locations.description: Apostle to Edessa and founder of the Church of the East

summary: Addai, also known as Thaddeus of Edessa, was one of the Seventy Disciples and is venerated as the Apostle to Edessa and founder of the Church of the East. According to the Doctrine of Addai, he was sent by Thomas the Apostle to heal King Abgar V of Edessa and establish Christianity in Mesopotamia. He is credited with converting the people of Edessa and establishing one of the earliest Christian communities outside the Roman Empire. The Church of the East traces its apostolic succession through Addai.
